intro: Alsine purpurea var. longipes, commonly known as purple sandparsley, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered leaves that are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces showy, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Alsine purpurea var. longipes is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables.
